intro: Anoplophytum stramineum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh environments. Anoplophytum stramineum is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or dry habitats.
